reviews.text: The castle with everything, Roman, Norman, late Medieval and Edwardian Arts and Crafts movement at it's very best. There is also the Museum of the Welsh Soldier and lovely grounds. To cap it all, the castle is smack bang in the city centre, so all the shops and restaurants you could ever want are right outside the gate.

This is my favourite castle in the UK. I love this more than the castle at Warwick and Edinburgh. Something about the way it is built is very endearing. I can come here over and over again just for the view from atop Norman Keep. Not to mention the keep itself is a stunning view in its own.

Thoroughly enjoyed our visit. Great value for money.  The entrance fee isn't too expensive and an audio guide is included in the price, which is really helpful.  It was very busy, but the staff were efficient and helpful, so the queues moved quickly.  There's a lot to see and loads of history to learn about. I recommend you don't miss this.
Great tour of the stunningly decorated castle rooms. Very informative and interesting history. I highly recommend the tour at £3.50.

I went to the Castle on a school trip with the primary school I work at. The children really enjoyed the day which included a guided tour of the castle and a story telling workshop. It was a really enjoyable day.

This is a stunning place outside and inside. The decor inside is a mix of beautiful rich woods and coal mining black metal and sparkling glass. Staff were so friendly and helpful. The gift shop is small but lovely merchandise. I went to see Macbeth and bought several quirky things connected to the play. Will definitely be back here.

Amazing place. I can’t believe all the materials used to build this place are sourced locally in Wales. The theatre is amazing and the acoustics are phenomenal. Ive been here on a number of occasions and there are great facilities to be able to get a drink and a snack before or after the performance.

Wales Millennium Centre is a pleasure to visit and is perfect for a family day out. The show selection is good, pricing is acceptable and there are events held for children activities. 

The only downside is the cafe - they don't have many food selections, pricing is high and the seating is uncomfortable. 

Toilets, wheelchair access and baby changing services are superb.

It's a really interesting building on the outside, I know its not to all tastes but I like it and it does stand very proud in the stunning Cardiff bay setting.
The theatre itself is spacious and grand with some wonderful production's visting on tours over the years.
I find the staff very friendly and helpful.
I'm not so keen on the upper circle and many stairs.
For the lady's there always seems a large queue at the toilets
But I always enjoy my visits to the Millennium centre.

I adore this venue. There's a great view of the stage wherever you sit (I usually sit in the back upper circle) and the atmosphere is always fantastic. Definitely something that Wales should be proud of.

Lovely place. Disabled toilet good, It was a bit tight entrance for me in a wheelchair, but great space in the circular room off the café area. Very interesting displays. 
Was able to teach staff about assistance dogs and their right to enter their premises. Super coffees and cakes. Recommended.
Visited for the coffee not the religious experience. It a great place to sit and watch the Bay life pass by. The sofa by the windows over looking the bay are highly desirable
A great place to learn about Welsh love spoons and other Norwegian church history. Me and my partner visited the place. Bought  2 beautiful hand-made necklaces. I love them.
Highly recommend for a stop off, and a cup of tea. Didn't try the cakes this time but will definitely be back.

Pretty little church sat on the waters edge in Cardiff Bay. Lovely little cafe inside with stunning views and freindly staff and upstairs is an art gallery displaying hand crafted goods. Also they sometimes have evening entertainment.

Stunning fairy tale castle built by a Scottish laird on the ruins of a Welsh castle at the end of the nineteenth century and decorated by an Englishman. Still, this joint effort produced one of the prettiest castles anywhere, well worth a visit.
Lovely place they are in the process of doing it up. Very enchanted look and the little paths in the wood made it more like a fairy tale place. Would go back when weather is warmer

First visit here. Lovely building with walks through surrounding woodland. The rooms have amazing decorations, really impressive. Small gift shop, cafe, and toilets. Lots of steps to the upstairs rooms via spiral stone stairs. There is a viewing screen for visitors who cannot negotiate the stairs.
Outstanding place. Full of history and real interesting.  Some nice walks to be had around the area to.
Great small folly castle which children love exploring. Lots of steps! Small café serving sandwiches and cake. Interactive games on mobile phones that delight young explorers

I loved the museum. Such a great place to visit. So much history, I loved the dinosaurs and everything about the solar system and the crystals. There's about 5 floors from what I remember and each floor and something different. The history of art really interesting too, some beautiful painting. Definitely worth a visit.

Wow, what a fantastic museum for free. Huge amounts to see. Art of all periods and style. Natural history of Wales in chronological order is very good. Really interesting artifacts. Very impressed as we've paid more for a lot less. Great afternoon activity.

Worth a visit for the History of Wales exhibit which seems semi permanent. Various other exhibits changed from time to time. Free entry, Coffee shop snack bar in the entrance hall and more substantial menu in the basement restaurant.

Took 2 kids (5 and 9) here and had an amazing time. The natural history part is superb, with some really impressive exhibits. However, the best part is the kid-friendly "discovery" centre. Super friendly and knowledgeable staff who are happy to answer a *lot* of questions. Amazing microscope, and loads of artifacts kids can actually touch!

Also, it's a very comfortable place to be - lots of space, and just the right temperature.

We spent almost 4 hours there.

Brilliant place for families.  My son enjoyed the dinosaur exhibition and my daughter enjoyed the art exhibition.
Friendly staff on hand to answer questions,  we had a great visit.

Wonderful museum with lovely filmed accounts of local people and Cardiffs history.
Find out about history of local pies,river fishermen steel workers and more.
Don't forget to have a look at the amazing tiles in the old library entrance!
Museum is FREE and it has a cafe upstairs with table service and helpful staff

Small but nice place to take your kids. There is some games and activities for them. You can find brief history of Cardiff. And also there is mini cinema shows Iron and coal factories. There is 4-5 screens explains some important things about specific years. It is just in city centre. You can find easily.
Cute little museum. Very informative. Staff were lovely and the gift shop was great and well priced!
Always lots to look at dinky dinos is great messy play for the little ones. Staff are always friendly and knowledgeable. Fun for all the family
Great place  to go on a rainy day  with the kids

A set menu with limited but good choices and very good food. Open 5pm to about 7.30 and tailored to the times of shows and concerts in the Millennium Centre. Pleasant atmosphere and views of Mermaid Quay.
Great spot for a quick pre-gig bite to eat.

I prbooked for two of us. We waited 45 minutes for the starter
 Nice but tiny. Main appauling. I had a small luke warm of pasta . Tiny bit of spinach.  My partner had a tiny piece of meat. Chips cold. When we complained hot chips brought. But i was told the pasra was meant to They said becsuse i had prebooked they could not offer a refund. Will never go there again. @!!cold !!!   Offeted icecream to recompense but both diabetics so refused.

Me and my boyfriend came here before wicked last night not knowing what to expect. We had a prepaid set menu voucher and I was extremely impressed. The waitress was so helpful and nothing was too much trouble and the food was amazing! Highly recommend!

Tonight we ate at Ffresh with their new menu. It was basically an assortment of small plates chosen from a book that would have rivalled War and Peace. 

There were just too many pages to go through, taster menu, fish, meat. Vegetarian, vegan. All we wanted was a starter and a main course not bits and bobs. 

This was more like a tapas menu not what we want when we go to a restaurant. Normally we eat there a lot but we wont be dining there again until they have an al a carte menu back in place.

Service wasn’t great with a waiter trying to clear away our used plates while we were still eating I literally had to stop him taking the one plate that still had half a flatbread on it. 

We usually love the food there so we were seriously disappointed tonight.

If you want quality sushi for a reasonable price, this is the place to go. They have a variety of different dishes to choose from, and i can assure you that you won't be disappointed. The staff are friendly, and the sushi is prepared within 10 minutes. I can recommend the grilled eel there, it's pretty good.
High quality sushi, very reasonable prices.
My favorite place to buy sushi. The space is very small so this is not a place to sit down and dine, but it's perfect for take away.

Compact restaurant, but cosy. Price is reasonable (at least in Norway). The staffs are very friendly. I saw people walk in and out, and they were greeted by the staffs, looks like they know their neighborhood customers pretty well. 
The only little down side is the tuna could be more fresh. I’m from Japan, it’s pretty easy to tell the freshness of your fish. 
Overall, not bad!
Probably the best sushi I have ever ate. Fresh and tasteful fish, reasonable price and very good sushi. If you are sushi lover and you are in Bergen - check it!

We had an amazing dinner at this restaurant, starting with the yummy appetizers that we thought we filled up on, to the sweets. The Main dishes were great. We were a group of ten, including children of different ages and very picky ones. Their signature dishes of Mina lamb and chicken were full of flavors. My son ordered garlic bread/ was the best!!. Clean, nicely and tastefully decorated. Very unique, highly recommend it, especially to anyone visiting from overseas.

I had never tried Lebanese food before visiting Mina, but I will definitely be having it again now! I've rarely been to a restaurant where the food was cooked so perfectly and with such attention to detail. The restaurant is small, but has a great, cost atmosphere and is very reasonably priced. If you've also never tried Lebanese food, this is the place to try it!
Excellent food. Excellent atmosphere. Lovely staff. Will definitely come back.
Been here many times, never fails to deliver. Food always very good, and staff very friendly. Our favourite, go-to restaurant in Cardiff.
Really tasty food.  Could do with better explanations on the menu

Expensive unless you can eat your own body weight!  Lovely food.  Wide range of dishes.  Small desserts........just the right size after what we ate!  Staff pleasant and polite even on a busy Thursday evening.  I'd go again........take Tupperware!

Love this place, loads of range of meals, all you can eat and also all you can drink on soft drinks. Seems a little pricey when you arrive, but you can soon get good value for that money you’ve spent. I particularly like the grill which will cook your choice of meat in front of you and to your liking! Well worth a visit!
Really nice place that I last went to 3/4 years ago. Much improved. Food was really tasty and very much improved from the last time. Will be going again.

Been here before as Cosmos and JRC. Nowadays it's lovely inside, clean and calm. However, don't be fooled. The floors are sparkling on the customer side but have a look behind the counters at the drains filled with rubbish, spills and food waste on the floor and generally poor hygiene. Food wise, I've found this place okay previously but our most recent visit was disgusting and we will not be returning. The sweet and sour chicken tasted like Birds Eye Cod from the frozen section of Tesco. I love seafood, but chicken should not taste like fish! Food temps were varied, at best it was warm. We started fresh 3 different times and failed to find anything edible. The thought of the poor hygiene we had seen lingering in our minds really didn't help! Oh yes  and the cherry on top was the guy who served us took the drinks vouchers from us, we were never given glasses and then when we asked for them they were reluctant to give them to us without an argument. Disappointed would be polite!

Went there this afternoon. Shocking, food warm not alot of choice what was there was bland and tasted of fish, so it was cooked in the same place as fish and I did not have any fish not that there was any fish dishes. My brother recommend it said there was a good choice Italian food pasta meat balls etc, there was none of that. Pizza looked as if it had seen better days. I have always tipped, but in this case I did not. It was terrible, will not be going back!!!!!

Absolutely love this place! Always so friendly and welcoming. The hotel, Restaurant and Spa are fab! Ian has been our waiter on several occasions in the last few months, and like all staff here, he is prepared to go above and beyond. Highly recommend!

Max was outstanding.  Some of the best customer service we've had.  Visited for a birthday meal and he made it so special.  The rest of the team were also fantastic when food was brought out, polite, funny and because of all this I would definatley go back.  Great restaurant.
Went there for a birthday treat for our son's birthday. Good food, with an interesting twist with Wasabi. Excellent service.
Amazing place to get a chilled out massage. I had hot stones...

Lovely room and views but poor choice of teas for afternoon tea. Only English Breakfast and Earl Grey as traditional teas. 3 green and mint and 3 infusions. Many more in other venues. Service a bit slow on busy day
